content.$: date: 3/6/2011, razor: 122, brush: 32, cream: 140, preshave: Softening with lather, aftershave: 141, numpasses: 3, notes: The Calypso shave! A pretty decent shave, I used a new strop and I liked it! I sliced myself 4 freaking times, hence the bad Nicks grade. But the lather was great (I used more product, and it worked!) and I got it fairly close. The neck sucked, of course, but I'm getting slightly better at it., gradelather: 3, gradecloseness: 2, gradenicks: 1, strop: 139

date: 3/2/2011, razor: 120, brush: 97, cream: 138, preshave: Softening with lather, aftershave: 137, numpasses: 3, notes: Well, a pretty good shave! I'm still not sure about the razor, but I think my improving stropping technique is helping with it. I'm definitely dialing well into the direction of the passes and stretching. I did XTG2 (S->N) for my second pass on the neck again. This could quickly become the SStd I am looking for. There's only a little bit of coarseness on my neck and the nicks I got were pretty small and didn't last to the ASM. All in all, a very fun and comfortable shave!, gradelather: 3, gradecloseness: 2, gradenicks: 2, strop: 118

date: 2/28/2011, razor: 111, brush: 32, cream: 136, preshave: Softening with lather, aftershave: 137, numpasses: 3, notes: Well, the lather wasn't bad. I used plenty of cream but not enough water so it kept drying out into flurries on my face. The razor was really well stropped. I actually heard the sound I'm supposed to hear which I thought I had been hearing all of this time. One of the keys with it, I think, is that I could hear it while on the canvas. It wound up being a pretty darn close shave, although I did have a pretty nasty slice. It took me about an hour from shower to finish, so not too bad. I could probably shave off some time - particularly if I was smarter about the lathering. One important thing I did this time was to, on my neck, go WTG, XTG2 (S->N) and XTG. This, coupled with near-the-blade stretching, afforded me a lot more whisker removal. The third pass was just to go with the BBS, I could have gotten away with just two passes pretty well, gradelather: 2, gradecloseness: 3, gradenicks: 2, strop: 118

date: 2/26/2011, razor: 122, brush: 97, soap: 135, preshave: Softening with lather, aftershave: 74, numpasses: 3, notes: Well, this was a hurried and quick shave because I dicked around with the SOTD pic and fixing the toilet and wound up not having much time to get ready to go see A Comedy of Errors. Interestingly, it didn't wind up being a horrible shave. The lather smelled great but I didn't do a great job until I reloaded the brush for my last pass. I used too much water, I think. I suck at lathering. The razor wasn't as sharp as I have had with it in the past but I blame my poor stropping skills. As a consequence, I missed quite a few whiskers and sliced myself a bit. All nicks and cuts were good by the time I applied the balm. I did a WTG, XTG, XTG2 on all of my face. Essentially, not a great shave, but way better than I had expected for the time I spent. Clearly my earlier time investments were not worth it., gradelather: 3, gradecloseness: 2, gradenicks: 2, strop: 118

date: 2/24/2011, razor: 120, brush: 32, cream: 133, preshave: Softening with lather, aftershave: 134, numpasses: 3, notes: An excellent shave! I'm really starting to get the hang of this Dovo, and the lather was freaking wonderful! Seriously, the Rose was so sophisticated and wonderful, and that cream soap lathers thick and slick. Kickass!, gradelather: 3, gradecloseness: 2, gradenicks: 3, strop: 118

date: 2/22/2011, razor: 111, brush: 97, soap: 129, preshave: Softening with lather, aftershave: 130, numpasses: 3, notes: Well, the lather sucked. I think I used too much water, but it took two restarts (one right after the first pass) before I got good lather. The razor is still wonderful and it helped me realize that what I thought was XTG on my neck - particularly the right side - is actually ATG! I will need to investigate this further!, gradelather: 2, gradecloseness: 2, gradenicks: 2, strop: 118

date: 2/20/2011, razor: 122, brush: 32, soap: 127, preshave: Softening with lather, aftershave: 128, numpasses: 3, notes: CRAP! If it weren't for the one slice on my cheek (because I'm an idiot) this would have been the most perfect shave! 3 easy passes (StdP on the cheeks plus WTG, WTG &   XTG on the neck), great lather (although it got bubbly when I added a bunch more water as an experiment) and no razor burn (just one nick). KICKASS! THIS IS WHY I DEVOTE SO MUCH TIME TO THIS! The razor was absolutely excellent. It's a keeper., gradelather: 3, gradecloseness: 3, gradenicks: 2, strop: 118

date: 2/17/2011, razor: 120, brush: 97, soap: 126, preshave: Softening with lather, aftershave: 116, numpasses: 3, notes: Well, it's an OK shave. No real nicks, although I did have a couple, which explains the grade on that. The biggest issue was trying to get a close shave. I'm not sure if Lynn Abrams sucks at honing or if the modern blade is kinda sucky. Perhaps I shouldn't blame the tools? I'll have to see when I shave with it next week. So, my 100th shave wasn't anything amazing, but not that bad. Also, I love my scuttle! I don't need it, but I'm glad I have it!, gradelather: 3, gradecloseness: 1, gradenicks: 2, strop: 118

date: 2/15/2011, razor: 111, brush: 32, cream: 124, preshave: Softening with lather, aftershave: 125, numpasses: 3, notes: FANTASTIC SHAVE!! Only 3 passes (StdP on the cheeks and WTG, WTG, XTG on the neck). My cheeks are perfectly BBS and my neck is pretty freaking good. It's not that perfect as I left quite a bit of stragglers, but it's not that rough. I am starting to really get the hang of this!, gradelather: 3, gradecloseness: 2, gradenicks: 2, strop: 118

date: 2/13/2011, razor: 122, brush: 97, soap: 123, preshave: Softening with lather, aftershave: 29, numpasses: 3, notes: Well, a 3 pass shave with a str8!! The results? Well, I did a StdP on my cheeks, but for my neck I did two WTG and one XTG (down). The results, you ask again? Well, the only difference between this shave and the last one is that I don't have nearly as much razor burn! In fact, it's the most comfortable shave I've had in weeks. This is why I gave it such good marks when I had one nick next to my mouth and I cut my freaking finger! The razor was totally awesome, comfortable in my hand and sharp. During my first pass (and during the softening, really) I found that I had failed my lather roll and it was all dried out. So, I squeezed what was in the brush and tried again, this time with a bit more water. This time I got beautiful lather that did it's job and still smelled amazing! Great shave!!, gradelather: 3, gradecloseness: 2, gradenicks: 2, strop: 118

date: 2/11/2011, razor: 120, brush: 97, soap: 121, preshave: Softening with lather, aftershave: 45, numpasses: 4, notes: Ok, so I did my best not to overdo this, and it turned into a pretty good shave! The new razor is excellent and gorgeous! The MB soap smelled wonderful but I found a little hard to lather well, plus it burned a little bit. It's so freaking obnoxious, but it could be related to the amount of soap I used to create some good lather. Overall, it was an excellent shave. My cheeks are BBS, but my neck not so much. My technique sucks. But at least this time I didn't just keep shaving and shaving and shaving my face raw. Overall, a pretty good shave!, gradelather: 2, gradecloseness: 2, gradenicks: 2, strop: 118

date: 2/9/2011, razor: 111, brush: 97, soap: 119, preshave: Softening with lather, aftershave: 89, numpasses: 5, notes: I had such high hopes for this shave. A new strop. A new soap. A fresh attitude. Well, two out of three, at least. For starters, I really didn't strop long enough. I really needed to think about that next time. Not to mention not using so much pressure. For the shave itself, I am taking way to freaking long with each pass. The lather in the last 3 or 4 shaves keeps drying out before I'm done! I'm trying to be so meticulous, I'm overdoing it. Probably need to do longer strokes. Plus, 5 passes is ridiculous. It was WTG, StdP and a XTG/ATG hybrid. I should know better than to do that crap. Next shave, I am going for 3 passes only. I should be able to do this with a StdP only. , gradelather: 3, gradecloseness: 3, gradenicks: 1, strop: 118

date: 2/7/2011, razor: 111, brush: 97, soap: 115, preshave: Softening with lather, aftershave: 116, numpasses: 4, notes: My first birthday shave! I tried the first pass with The Boss and really didn't like the high amount of drag. I decided that it must be too dull and I should get it overhauled! So I switched to the red point and it was a lot more comfortable. I had one tiny, minuscule nick below my chin which didn't even bleed. Also, razor burn was really minimal, which is great considering how close it of a shave it was. It wasn't BBS, but it is certainly close. I can really get used to shaving like this! , gradelather: 3, gradecloseness: 2, gradenicks: 3, strop: 51

date: 2/4/2011, razor: 111, brush: 32, cream: 114, preshave: Softening with lather, aftershave: 45, numpasses: 4, notes: Well, I am certainly getting better at this. I still got a bit of razor burn on my neck and got about 4 nicks that didn't last past the AS stage. I also learned that my first XTG pass on my neck should be downwards. A decent shave, for sure. I am getting better at this!, gradelather: 3, gradecloseness: 2, gradenicks: 2, strop: 51

date: 2/2/2011, razor: 111, brush: 97, soap: 14, preshave: Softening with lather, aftershave: 36, numpasses: 4, notes: Ok, so this shave took me several steps farther along into wet shaving. First, the lather. I put a top grade on it although it did dry out a bit on my face after the first pass, but I corrected that easily with a few drops of water. Otherwise, it was thick and velvety and perfect! Turns out I've really been using a lot of water in my lathers. I started with a dry bowl and a mostly dry brush. I put enough water on the puck to cover the whole thing and really did some small swirling. Turned out perfectly! Secondly, I am starting to really understand what they mean by a light touch. With the proper angle and a light touch, the razor just glides over the face while still erasing the whiskers. I have what is probably the the closest shave I have ever had. I decided to shave WTG StdP. I realized that one of the possible problems I might have been having is that I wasn't reducing enough during my first WTG pass and that, just because StdP is what works for me with a DE, there's no reason to think that that's what will work with a Str8. So, for a while now, I'll be going back to doing 4 passes. But, this shave has proven to me that it is possible to get BBS with a Str8 without going ATG. My right cheek is 4-way BBS as well as parts of my neck!. I did suffer 3 - that's three - slices, one of which wound up in a huge scab, for some reason. And I did have some razor burn around my neck because a) it's pretty tough to get the correct angle while shaving my neck and b) because of the previous point, I tend to be a bit more apprehensive and didn't have the light touch I was using on my cheeks. But, I am getting better at angling and stretching in order to get the neck whiskers in the correct direction. I'll really have to put that mirror up though. I keep having to lean into the sink to look at myself in the mirror. So, in summary: learning light touch and angling plus recapturing lathering knowledge. A really fun shave!, gradelather: 3, gradecloseness: 3, gradenicks: 2, strop: 51

date: 1/31/2011, razor: 111, brush: 97, soap: 87, preshave: Softening with lather, aftershave: 55, numpasses: 4, notes: Well... This was a disappointing shave, at first. In fact, it felt like I wasn't shaving with anything at all during the shave, and I was just rasping at the whiskers. But post-shave, although it's not that close of a shave, it's still close enough and it feels really comfortable. I didn't have that much razor burn and no bleeding nicks at all. This shave was greatly affected by not having shaved in about 4 days and needing to do a WTG reduction pass before the StdP. As for the lather, it sucked at first. But then I decided that I didn't have enough product and had used too much water so, with a little push by the brush falling in the sink, I relathered the bowl and got a nice, thick lather. Will be buying some SCS soap toot sweet!, gradelather: 3, gradecloseness: 2, gradenicks: 2, strop: 51

date: 1/27/2011, razor: 43, brush: 97, soap: 28, preshave: Softening with lather, aftershave: 74, numpasses: 3, notes: So, this was... not a comfortable shave. I knew it would, but the soap burned... It's so freaking sad. I can't use any good-smelling soaps!! :( So I didn't have any big slices, but a lot of little nicks. My neck got a little bit of razor burn, but no worse than the other times. I think around the last pass it was getting a bit dull. My stropping clearly needs some work. I'll also need to compare when the new razor gets here. All-in-all, I still want to continue shaving exclusively with str8s, I just hope I get a lot better at it soon!, gradelather: 3, gradecloseness: 2, gradenicks: 1, strop: 51

date: 1/25/2011, razor: 43, brush: 32, cream: 107, preshave: Softening with lather, aftershave: 55, numpasses: 3, notes: Well, this was WAY better than last time. I still had a bit of razor burn and nicked myself in several places (all of it on my neck), but it was still better. And, better yet, it was a close shave. I really got a good handle on stretching, especially around the third pass. I think if I keep shaving exclusively with a str8, then I'll really get pretty good at it and I think I might wind up liking this more than DE shaving! I used a modified StdP with an XTG1 first on my neck. Pretty decent shave., gradelather: 3, gradecloseness: 3, gradenicks: 1, strop: 51

date: 1/23/2011, razor: 43, brush: 97, soap: 65, preshave: 104, aftershave: 105, numpasses: 3, notes: Well, a pretty decent shave! It was a str8 shave, so I wound up with a red face, and a cut or two, but not as bad as the last time. I think I'm going to shave with it a lot more. The soap sucked for the first time I created the lather, but when I tried again, it was fluffy and slick. Still need to decide between it and Tabac. Not so sure about the pre-shave., gradelather: 3, gradecloseness: 2, gradenicks: 1, strop: 51

date: 1/17/2011, razor: 12, blade: 70, brush: 39, cream: 106, preshave: Softening with lather, aftershave: 55, numpasses: 3, notes: So I did WTG, XTG2 and XTG and I have a really close shave. Also, I'm really starting to dislike the penchetta. It's so freaking floppy that all I can do is paint the lather on my face since swirling does nothing. Lastly, I loved the sandalwood cream enough that I decided to buy it next month! :) great shave!, gradelather: 2, gradecloseness: 3, gradenicks: 3

date: 8/26/2010, razor: 23, blade: 70, brush: 32, soap: 87, preshave: Softening with lather, aftershave: 29, numpasses: 4, notes: Well, a much better experience with the redtip than I had before! But that was due to the extra attention I gave that area. The soap was wonderful if not a little too effervescent and I still really love my S2K! I shaved WTG, WTG, XTG and XTG2., gradelather: 2, gradecloseness: 3, gradenicks: 2

date: 8/22/2010, razor: 43, brush: 39, cream: 84, preshave: Softening with lather, aftershave: 85, numpasses: 4, notes: Ok, so not too bad. I got a new filly since I killed the first one. So now I was able to actually strop correctly and it felt better. It wasn't an awesome shave, but it wasn't that bad either! It wasn't very close, but I didn't have as much razor burn as the last few times. At this point, although my stropping technique needs tons of work, the biggest problem was a manner of angles actual shaving technique. The cream smelled amazing, but I used too much water so it was quite bubbly. The aftershave felt great on my face, but smelled a little girly. I shaved WTG, WTG and XTG with a 4th pass of just my neck XTG. A pleasant enough shave and not as frustrating as the previous str8 shaves. THERE'S HOPE!, gradelather: 2, gradecloseness: 1, gradenicks: 2, strop: 51

The cream was spectacular and awesome. What sucked was the blade. Seriously, I could feel it digging into my skin at every other stroke and it was only the second time I had used it! A total POS! It made it so that I would not dare a BBS shave. The passes were WTG, WTG, XTG and a very light XTG2. I wish I had used an astra blade!, gradelather: 3, gradecloseness: 1, gradenicks: 2

date: 8/17/2010, razor: 12, blade: 77, brush: 39, cream: 78, preshave: Softening with lather, aftershave: 74, numpasses: 4, notes: WOW! A great shave! I did have a little bit of razor burn on the right side of my Adam's apple plus a couple of nicks in that general area that didn't last past the cold water splash. The cream smelled amazing and was very, very slick, the brush was soft and felt wonderful, I got a true BBS shave and the aftershave is the perfect scent to go with this cream. FRAKING AWESOME!, gradelather: 3, gradecloseness: 3, gradenicks: 2

date: 8/15/2010, razor: 43, brush: 72, soap: 75, preshave: Softening with lather, aftershave: 76, numpasses: 3, notes: Well... crap... I think I need to get a new strop :( I don't think my razor was sharp enough. I got a bunch of nicks and missed a TON of whiskers on the left side of my neck. Annoyed me, but, whatever. I did get one very awesome swipe on the right side of my neck that took care of most of the whiskers. will have to figure out how I did that. The Speick smelled great and was pretty good. My only complaint about it was that, even after I loaded my face twice and seemed like I had an immense amount of lather on the brush, I didn't really have enough for the last pass. , gradelather: 3, gradecloseness: 1, gradenicks: 1, strop: 51

The aftershave was really nice and soothing and I loved it! The blade held up quite well and I only had a couple of small nicks. For the first three passes, I did WTG, WTG and XTG. The fourth pass was just of the neck with XTG and 45XTG passes., gradelather: 2, gradecloseness: 2, gradenicks: 2

As for the blades: no complaints. Lastly, I love my S2K! Can't wait to try the next boar!!, gradelather: 2, gradecloseness: 2, gradenicks: 2

date: 7/30/2010, razor: 12, blade: 17, brush: 8, soap: 65, preshave: Softening with lather, aftershave: 29, numpasses: 4, notes: Well, it was an OK shave. Face-lathered with the nice, scrubby EJBBB and the MWF and I really liked it! Lots of fluffy, creamy lather that lasted all 4 passes. It wasn't a really close shave - lots of bad patches, particularly on my neck. BUT, the only two, small nicks I got were on my left jaw line - NONE ON MY NECK!! I still had razor burn on the anti-part of death, but no blood, so that's good! It's not the most comfortable of shaves, but it could have been much worse. , gradelather: 3, gradecloseness: 2, gradenicks: 2

date: 7/27/2010, razor: 12, blade: 56, brush: 32, soap: 64, preshave: Softening with lather, aftershave: 41, numpasses: 4, notes: Well, this was an uncomfortable shave! For starters, the soap burned! :( It wasn't unbearable, but it certainly wasn't comfortable! Now, it's certainly a close shave. Closer than even the last one, actually. I did a pretty good job! On my neck - particularly on the left side - I employed a kind of J-hooking but horizontally. That worked pretty well! On the right side - right on the vortex of pain and evil - I hacked away at it like a stubborn piece of ligament stuck to bone and I just about separated the pesky skin from muscle. Seriously, I really fucked it up. It's close, but I have like two dozen bleeding spots and, since this was a morning shave (in Uniontown, PA), my face didn't have that much time to recover before I had to face the world. Lastly, the lather didn't really last for 3 passes. By the third pass, it dried out on my face while I was shaving the first cheek. I had to reapply soap. I think that's my fault - not enough loading - but thought I would mention it. One more thing to bitch at: since the mirror was in the same room as the shower, I had to wipe it constantly due to fog. I like our house., gradelather: 2, gradecloseness: 3, gradenicks: 1

date: 7/25/2010, razor: 12, blade: 56, brush: 8, cream: 63, preshave: Softening with lather, aftershave: 29, numpasses: 4, notes: This is probably the most consistently close shave I have had yet. There's a small part on the upper area of my left cheek, but, other than that, it's perfect. I did have a number of nicks on my neck when I went ATG on it. The other 3 passes were WTG, WTG and XTG, respectively. I really need to learn how to get a close, nickless shave on my neck, but it also could have been worse. I also used my EJBBB for the first time in a long while. Pretty freaking scrubby! I didn't even realize! I liked it, but I think it would have been better for face-lathering. Overall, it was a great shave and I really enjoyed it!, gradelather: 2, gradecloseness: 3, gradenicks: 2

date: 7/22/2010, razor: 12, blade: 56, brush: 39, cream: 61, preshave: Softening with lather, aftershave: 62, numpasses: 4, notes: A WONDERFUL SHAVE! The 4th pass wasn't a full one. Just taking care of spots, but I thought I should include it. I achieved BBS on 99.5% of my face with the other 0.5% being a few straggling hairs, not whole areas. It was a fairly comfortable shave although I did mess up the anti-part area of my neck and got a couple of spot nicks. Other than that, I love it! I remember, once again, what I love about the results!, gradelather: 3, gradecloseness: 3, gradenicks: 2

date: 7/20/2010, razor: 59, blade: 56, brush: 39, cream: 60, preshave: Softening with lather, aftershave: 36, numpasses: 3, notes: This razor scraped my face OFF. There was no point in the comb 'guard' as it offered no protection. So that sucked. Now, the lather was AWESOME! I didn't wring the brush out like I do with soap - just shook it a couple of times - and added a more water as I went along. It was fluffy and wonderful, plus it smelled great! I used way too much product so I wound up with TONS of cream I didn't use. I went WTG, WTG, XTG, and did get BBS on my cheeks and kinda close on my neck, but with tons of blood spots and razor burn. It was a terribly uncomfortable shave, but at least I learned some more about lathering., gradelather: 3, gradecloseness: 2, gradenicks: 1

date: 7/18/2010, razor: 43, brush: 32, soap: 58, preshave: Softening with lather, aftershave: 50, numpasses: 3, notes: Well, I butchered my face! It was totally horrible. I nicked my face and, in particular, my neck about 10 times and cut myself twice. There's a non-smooth part on the edge of the razor. I think it needs to be rehoned. My cheeks are BBS, but my neck isn't. I got kinda close, but it resulted in a lot of irritation. Also I still suck at face lathering without a stick. I think next shave I will try to shave with distilled water and see how that goes., gradelather: 2, gradecloseness: 2, gradenicks: 0, strop: 51

date: 7/15/2010, razor: 12, blade: 56, brush: 32, soap: 57, preshave: Softening with lather, aftershave: 29, numpasses: 3, notes: Well, this was an AWESOME shave. For starters, I used a shave stick! Rubbed it on my face and seconds after applying the brush, great lather just burst out of my face! If this is how it always is with shave sticks, I really need to grab more. In fact, the brush felt wonderful on my face and the stink is almost completely gone! For this shave, I focused a lot on then angle. All this time I was doing more like a 7 or more. This time I focused more on a 6 and it really made a huge difference. It was a wonderful shave, right up until I decided to go ATG on my neck. Had a slew of nicks and razor burn. Terrible idea. As for the new blade... No clue. Felt good until I sliced my neck off. We shall see next shave., gradelather: 3, gradecloseness: 2, gradenicks: 1

date: 7/13/2010, razor: 53, blade: 48, brush: 32, soap: 54, cream: 52, preshave: Softening with lather, aftershave: 55, numpasses: 3, notes: WOW! Well. I really had no clue what I was getting into with the open comb razor. It was REALLY aggressive and chewed up my face a bit. Also, I tried out face-lathering, which was OK. Wound up having to reload the brush after every pass. Not sure about that. I guess I have to learn a bit more? But, it was a DAMN close shave, especially for a 3 pass shave. Pretty awesome, I just wish it had also been comfortable., gradelather: 2, gradecloseness: 3, gradenicks: 1

I could have gotten away with just two passes, but the neck needed a bit more and I wanted BBS on the cheeks. Acceptable!, gradelather: 3, gradecloseness: 2, gradenicks: 1, strop: 51

date: 7/7/2010, razor: 47, blade: 48, brush: 39, cream: 49, preshave: Softening with lather, aftershave: 50, numpasses: 3, notes: Yup, an OK shave. It was VERY comfortable but it wasn't very close. date: 7/5/2010, razor: 43, brush: 39, cream: 44, preshave: Softening with lather, aftershave: 45, numpasses: 3, notes: Well, I hadn't set off to do so, but my entire shave was done with my new str8, The Boss :). Turns out I was using way too little product. Once I upped it (by too much!) I had more lather than I knew what to do with! I nicked myself 4 times in the cheeks and cut myself, a lot, twice under my chin. Just like last time! It only took 2 passes to get my cheeks smooth and parts of my neck were easier to get smooth than with a DE. I'm still working on it, but I'm getting better at it and I'm really liking it!, gradelather: 3, gradecloseness: 2, gradenicks: 0

The Marlborough was pretty decent, but I still don't like smelling like a board of wood. , gradelather: 2, gradecloseness: 1, gradenicks: 1

I did manage to nick myself quite a bit on my adam's apple going ATG with poor lather on the last pass, but what an experience! My technique has gotten a lot better, but the shaving cream really helped! I was able to generate a great lather and it provided a very slick and smooth skin surface for shaving. I tried the Ogallala and it smelled amazing, but my face got really, really hot, so I followed it by a quick splash of Aqua Velva to cool off. date: 4/18/2010, razor: 12, blade: 6, brush: 8, cream: 11, preshave: Softening with lather, aftershave: 1, numpasses: 4, notes: So my cheeks are definitely BBS. Not to mention that I nicked myself about 4 or 5 times, which is why it's a just a DFS. One was on the cheek, and one on the reverse part kept bleeding after I applied the styptic pencil to it! So I still have to work on that. As for the Aqua Velva, it burned like nothing else, but then the menthol kicked in and my face froze. It was awesome!!, gradelather: 2, gradecloseness: 2, gradenicks: 0
